title: U.S. - forecast for higher education outlays 2019 to 2030
yAxis: Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars
summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Year in the x axis and Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars in the y axis.
Fiscal Year '19 has the highest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars and '20 has the lowest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars.
The highest Fiscal Year '19 has 31.0 more Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars than the lowest Fiscal Year '20.
min_summary: This bar chart has 12 columns on the x axis representing Fiscal Year, and Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars in each Fiscal Year on the y axis.
The Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars is appeared to be the highest at Fiscal Year '19 and lowest at Fiscal Year '20.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Year in the x axis and Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars in the y axis.
Fiscal Year '19 has the highest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars and '20 has the lowest Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars.

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars for 12 number of Fiscal Years.
The maximum Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars 33.0 is found at Fiscal Year '19 and the minimum is found at '20 where Fiscal Year is 2.0.
Fiscal Year '22 has the second highest value for Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars.
The difference of Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Fiscal Year is 31.0.
Fiscal Year '19 is higher than any other Fiscal Years with value 33.0, followed by '22, and '22. Down to Fiscal Year '20 with the lowest value 2.0.
Fiscal Year '30, '29, '28, '27, '26, '25, '24, '23, and '22 share the same value 5.0.
Considered together, the average Higher education outlay in billion U.S. dollars in all 12 Fiscal Years is roughly 7.0.
Summing up the values of all Fiscal Years, we get total 84.0.
